N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 ยง 32.1 - General

State Regulations
(Tax Law, section 1515(f))
(a) Every corporation is a separate taxable
entity and shall file its own return. However, certain taxpayers subject to tax
under article 33 are required to file on a combined basis with related
corporations where: (1)
the capital stock
requirement is met; and
(2)
there
are substantial intercorporate transactions among the related
corporations. (b) Where
the capital stock requirement is met and substantial intercorporate
transactions are absent, a combined return covering corporations may be
permitted or required if the commissioner deems such a return necessary because
of inter-company transactions or some agreement, understanding, arrangement, or
transaction referred to in section 1515(g), in order to properly reflect the
tax liability under article 33. Notes
